title: Bug 4964 - Automatic Code Assist inserts incorrect item from the list
description: While writing SWT code, I type 'button.dispose'. At this point, I do not realize that the code assist list is up because I am not looking. There are 2 items in the list now: DISPOSED, intWidgetdispose(), voidWidget. I then type '(', because the line I was typing was supposed to be 'button.dispose();'. But as soon as I type '(', then automatic code assist inserts whatever is selected.
OB: Build 204 - The automatic code assist inserts 'DISPOSED' instead of the expected 'dispose()' method when I type 'button.dispose' and then type '('.
EB: The automatic code assist should notice that I have typed '(', and recognize that it matches 'dispose()' far better than 'DISPOSED'. It should then insert the 'dispose()' method from the code assist list instead of 'DISPOSED'.
SR:
1. Open the code editor.
2. Type 'button.dispose'.
3. Verify that the code assist list shows 'DISPOSED', 'intWidgetdispose()', 'voidWidget'.
4. Type '('.
5. Verify that the automatic code assist inserts 'dispose()' instead of 'DISPOSED'.
